description: From Notoungulata (order name), from Ancient Greek νότος (nótos, “south”) + Ungulata.

adjectives.description: notoungulate (comparative more notoungulate, superlative most notoungulate)

entries.meaning: (paleontology) Any of several extinct, hoofed, herbivorous mammals of the order Notoungulata, from Cenozoic South America. [from 20th c.]
examples: At its extreme, there are creatures whose teeth grow continuously, even as their gums recede with a lifetime of grit and grass, a strategy only known in woolly rhinos and notoungulates among larger animals.
